page.title: 08THE WORK OF A HARBOUR PILOT
page.content: Most vessels,apart from trawlers have to take a pilot onboard to navigate them in and out of the harbour. The pilot is taken out in a launch to meet the incoming vessels.In choppy seas it can be quite dangerous clambering aboard but on warm sunny days it seems to be a idyllic job! The 10 pilots work shifts of twelve hours now that Aberdeen is a 24 hour harbour due to increased shipping demands.The harbour can accomodate up to 50 supply vessels and a pilot can expect to deal with 20 vessels a day.Some companies prefer to use Peterhead Harbour since they dont have to use pilots and berthing costs are lower.It is the privilidge of the longest serving pilot to bring in the Royal Yacht 'Britannia' on her annual visit to Aberdeen when the Royal Family are in residence at Balmoral.
